resources.string: BEGIN YOUR JOURNEY ON THE LOCH NESS TOUR
Begin your very own tour experience
What would you like to do?
You have the power to create the experience you want
Select the section that corresponds to where you are on your journey. To have the best experience we do not recommend skipping ahead!
We have a selection of onboard entertainment options you can choose from. Please note wifi is restricted to certain parts of our journey due to network coverage in the Scottish highlands
We have lots of fun things for you to enjoy on your adventure around Scotland!
Join nessie as he goes to school for the first time. School can be a scary place for the first time but luckily, he\'s got a massive cock so he is full of confedence

This is some text that has been typed up to give an example of the type of stuff that will be going into this app. It has become very complicated to so this and I have lost the desire to ever become an app developer so Android can suck my balls.

It is your responsibility to check the condition of all portable equipment at the time of issue. Faults that are discovered or damage incurred while you are in possession of the equipment must be reported to the driver as soon as possible. If equipment becomes unusable it should be returned to the driver.All equipment is logged and monitored to ensure that we can trace the users in the event of damage or loss.You must not use the equipment in a way that breaches any Go Travel Scotland regulations or policy or that brings Go Travel Scotland into disrepute.Users are only permitted to use the tablet to follow the tour and make use of the free WiFiand ‘What’s On’ section to research things to do in Scotland.You may not record or duplicate any images, videos or text from our tour app. Equipment is to stay on the coach at all times. Users may not take the equipment off the coach at any destinations or stops. Equipment is monitored with GPS tracking and users maybe prosecuted for theft for taking equipment.Equipment must be returned as you leave the coach at the end of a tour.Each item should be returned in the condition in which it was borrowed. Do not change anysettings.All equipment must be returned directly to the driver. Customers who fail to comply with these conditions could face prosecution for damage or vandalism.
By using Go Travel Scotland equipment you are agreeing to the terms and conditions of booking listed above and you accept that you are fully responsible for any and all damage or loss to the equipment in your booking.
The first part of our video tour guide will follow the route we take from Edinburgh to Pitlochry. These videos are designed to give you a taste of Scottish history before we reach our destinations.

We depart the city on Edinburgh and head towards the Highlands and Pitlochry. There are many sights and interesting facts to learn along the way. Once you\'ve watched the videos check out the extra facts on some of the topics covered
We will shortly be crossing over the Firth of Forth.
Once we have crossed over the Firth of Forth we are now entering The Kingdom of Fife. \“Beggars mantel fringed with Gold\”
The ancient capital of the Highlands
Watch this video once we have left Perth
The town of Pitlochry is our first stop of today. Please speak to the driver about tickets for Cruise Loch Ness.
Make sure you have booked and paid for your tickets for Cruise Loch Ness! We now leave Pitlochry and travel towards Loch Ness.
The famous battle of Killiecrankie and the Soldiers Leap.
Learn about the Blair Atholl estate
A brief background on Scottish Whisky
Make sure you have booked and paid for your tickets for Cruise Loch Ness! We now leave Loch Ness and travel towards Fort Augustus.
We will be visiting Fort Augustus for almost 2 hours. Please be back at the coach at the time the driver requests.
The mystery of Loch Ness and the famous Nessie monster.
Quick photo stop at a statue to honour war heroes.
Largest west coast town at the base of Ben Nevis
Scotland’s landscape contains every type of rock found on earth.
The sad and vindictive tale of the massacre of the MacDonald clan at Glencoe.
The barren wasteland of Rannoch Moore
Scotland’s beautiful landscapes create idyllic walks and hikes.
You are welcome to purchase food at the quaint town of Callander and bring it on the coach to enjoy on our return journey to Edinburgh.
Make sure you have booked and paid for your tickets for Cruise Loch Ness! We now leave Callander and travel home.
This castle was used in the filming of Outlander, Monty Python and Game of Thrones.
The true story of a daring Scottish rogue.
Why not join us on our 1 day tour of Stirling Castle, Loch Lomond and a whisky distillery?
The true story of the great Scottish freedom fighter.
A famous battle where the Scottish defeated the English over 700 years ago.
King Robert the Bruce and the 1320 Declaration of Arbroath
